messages.content: You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users for researching a product. Based on the demographics provided, you will create a 6 questions screener to select the best users to interview

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting adults 18-55 located in the United States who suffer from eczema and/or dry itchy skin and searching for a topical non-steroidal cure to help us test a new healing lotion & skincare app.

1. Which statement best describes your overall skin health? (Select one)
- Overall healthy, skin gets itchy but it's manageable
- Recently dealing with eczema for the first time, trying various solutions
- Had eczema for a while, tried various OTC solutions
- Saw a dermatologist, got a prescription, & it's working...sometimes
- Working with my dermatologist, trying new prescriptions & approaches
- Near constant flare-ups. I've tried everything, I'm at the end of my rope.
- None of these - I don't have an ongoing problem with itchy skin.

2. In the past 6 months, which of the following have you done? (Select all that apply)
- Searched online for an eczema solution
- Booked or completed an appointment with a dermatologist
- Purchased an OTC cream (e.g. Aveeno, CeraVe, etc)
- Purchased an OTC steroid
- Tried a prescription biologic (e.g. Humira, Skyrizi, Opzelura, etc)
- Joined or visited an online eczema group (Facebook, Reddit, Whatsapp, etc)
- Downloaded a skin-related mobile app (e.g. Olay Skin Advisor, etc)
- Tried a prescription steroid
- Taken an oatmeal bath
- None of the above

3. How often does your skin condition keep you from doing something you want to do (e.g., fall asleep, wear short sleeves, go to a social gathering, etc)?
- multiple times a day
- daily
- few times a week
- weekly
- monthly
- occasionally
- never

4. Tell us about your skin care routine on a typical day. What products do you use? Where do you apply them? In what order? What time(s) of day? How do you deal with flare-ups vs. non-flare-ups? Please be detailed and specific.

5. What's working best for you right now about your current skin care regimen?

6. If you could change something about the products available to treat your skin, what would you wish for?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

2. In the past 6 months, which of the following have you done? (Select all that apply)
- Searched online for an eczema solution
- Booked or completed an appointment with a dermatologist
- Purchased an OTC cream (e.g. Aveeno, CeraVe, etc)
- Purchased an OTC steroid
- Tried a prescription biologic (e.g. Humira, Skyrizi, Opzelura, etc)

- Downloaded a skin-related mobile app (e.g. Olay Skin Advisor, etc)

- weekly

4. Tell us about your skin care routine on a typical day. What products do you use? Where do you apply them? In what order? What time(s) of day? How do you deal with flare-ups vs. non-flare-ups? Please be detailed and specific.

You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting new managers 25-45 located in Germany, England, the Netherlands, United States who are struggling to be a good manager & do their job well searching for management advice & coaching to help them succeed to help us test a coaching app for new managers.

1. How many direct reports do you have?
- 0
- 1-4
- 5-9
- 10+

2. In the past 12 months, which of the following have you tried? (Select all that apply)
- Executive coaching
- Leadership training workshop
- Online course on leadership or management
- Reading a book on leadership or management
- Joining a community of peers who want to improve leadership skills

3. In the past 2-3 weeks, which of these best describes how you felt at work:
- My days are a whirlwind - I'm struggling to stay on top of everything
- I can't control most of the things that happen to me - my day is mostly controlled by other people
- I feel energized and enthusiastic
- Most days are dreadful and I can't wait to sign off for the evening
- Sometimes I feel unproductive, but mostly I'm okay
- I feel calm and am able to concentrate
- Other

4. Tell us in detail about the last time you ran into a situation with your team where you didn't know what to do. What happened? How did you handle it? Please be detailed & specific.

5. What's working best about the support, tools, or resources you have right now? What's helping you the most?

6. In your efforts to grow as a leader, what kind of support, tools, or resources do you wish for? What do you wish was different about the current options you have?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting self-identified fashionistas 18-45 located in United States who love high-end designer clothes but can't afford them searching for a fun way to play dress-up with high-end designer clothes to help us test a new mobile fashion game where you build your dream closet.

1. In the last 6 months, which fashion-related activities have you engaged in? (Select all that apply)
- reading a fashion magazine (Vogue, Harpers, etc)
- reading fashion blog(s)
- following or browsing fashion content on social media (IG, snapchat, etc)
- giving feedback or advice on someone else's outfit
- soliciting feedback or advice on your outfit
- shopping for clothes with a friend
- renting an outfit for a special occasion
- purchasing an outfit for a special occasion
- Other
- None - I don't engage in fashion-related activities

2. In the past two months, how often did you play mobile games?
- multiple times a day
- daily
- few times a week
- weekly
- monthly
- occasionally
- never

3. In the last month, how much did you spend on gaming?
- under $10
- $10-25
- $25-50
- $51-99
- $100+

4. Describe a recent fashion-related experience (e.g. something from the list above). What did you do? Who else was involved? What was the outcome? (Please be detailed and specific.)

5. Tell me about a fashion-related moment of joy or satisfaction you experienced recently. What happened? What made it memorable for you?

6. If you could add or improve one specific thing about engaging with fashion in your daily life, what would it be?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting FD subscribers 25-55 located in The Netherlands who need specialized financial news in a timely manner searching for a better way to keep up to date with financial news to help us test a new personalized news feature for FD.

1. Which of these statements best describes your FD reading habits?
- During work, I only want FD-content relevant for my work, so I don't get distracted.
- When my company or a client's is in the news on FD, I want to know right away.
- News about specific company events (e.g. acquisitions, reoganisations, bankruptcies), I don't want to miss.
- To quickly make decisions to sell or buy stocks, I want relevant FD content efficiently grouped together.
- Other…

2. Which news sources do you read besides the FD?
- Financial Times
- Bloomberg
- The Economist
- Follow the Money
- Other
- None

3. Last month, which features of news providers did you use?
- FT - myFT (based on topics you follow: personal feed, notifications, email summaries)
- FT - curated thematic newsletters
- Follow the Money - Mijn FTM (based on authors, panels and dossiers you follow)
- Other

4. Walk me through a typical weekday, morning til evening, & tell us how you find the news you need.

5. What is the biggest challenge in finding the important articles on FD? How does that impact you?

6. If you could change one thing on FD to more easily find important articles: what would that be? Did you see a great solution somewhere else or do you have an idea of your own?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting digital professionals 25-55 located in United States, England, Israel, India who struggle to find product/market fit searching for education & coaching to help them find product/market fit faster to help us test a new educational workshop to help you find product/market fit.

1. How many people are employed by your company or organization?
- 1
- 2-9
- 10-50
- 51-5000
- 5000+
- other

2. How would you describe your role at work? Check all that apply.
- startup founder or co-founder
- small business owner
- freelancer or consultant
- executive leader - CXO, VP, Director
- Design / Product Leader at established company or consulting firm
- Design Partner / Product Leader at VC, Incubator, Accelerator
- investor - VC, Angel, Incubator, etc.
- Product Manager / Team Leader / Producer
- artist, animator, modeller, filmmaker
- programmer, software architect, engineer
- full-time or part-time student
- educator,  professor, teacher, coach

3. Which of these online courses appeals to you?
- Game Thinking Fundamentals: learn the Game Thinking system
- Superfan Fundamentals: find and mobilize your hot-core early customers
- Discovery Fundamentals: accelerate discovery with Concept Scenarios
- Cooperative Design Fundamentals: positive-sum design & winning together
- Progress Design Fundamentals: create compelling progression system
- Problem Solving Fundamentals: sharpen your problem-solving skills with games and puzzles
- Online Training: Become a Certified Game Thinking Design Coach

4. Tell us about the last time you took a course or workshop to build your professional skills. What was the course/workshop title? What was it like? Please be detailed & specific.

5. What did you like the most about this educational experience? What worked best?

6. What was frustrating or annoying about your educational experience? What would have made it better for you?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting adults 25-55 located in United States who are actively shopping for a new car searching for a car that'll save them money & be affordable in the long run to help us test a leasing program for electric car batteries.

1. What is your income range?
- Under $50,000
- Between $50,000 and $74,999
- Between $75,000 and $99,999
- Between $100,000 and $124,999
- Between $125,000 and $149,999
- Between $150,000 and $200,000
- Over $200,000

2. When do you intend to get your next vehicle?
- Soon, I'm actively looking
- Next 3 months
- Next year
- Next 3 years
- Not sure

3. What statement best describes your stance on electric vehicles?
- Currently have one, and love it
- Currently use, but intend to switch to non-EV
- Don't currently have an EV, but eager to get one
- Not sure, maybe later in the future
- No way, don't care for them

4. Describe the most recent situations that prompted you to consider getting a new vehicle. What triggered you, where was it at, who were you with, what did you see and think about?

5. Describe your process for considering purchasing/leasing of a particular vehicle. What do you do, what factors into your decision, where do you go for information?

6. What concerns do you have about purchasing/leasing an electric vehicle?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting adults 18-55 located in United States, England, Germany who used Geocaching in the past year searching for a better Geocaching experience to help us test an update to the Geocaching app.

1. When did you find your first geocache? A guesstimate is fine.
- Less than 1 month ago
- 1-3 months ago
- 4-6 months ago
- 7-12 months ago
- Over a year ago, but less than 2 years
- 2 or more years ago
- Other…

2. Which of these have you done in the last six months? Check all that apply
- Found a geocache in my neighborhood
- Found a geocache on a sunny day
- Found a geocache while traveling
- Found a geocache while hiking
- Walked to a geocache from my home
- Drove to a geocache
- Found a geocache alone
- Found a geocache with my dog
- Found a geocache with a friend
- Found a geocache with my family
- Found a geocache with my children
- Found a geocache with my significant other
- None of the above

3. Which of these have you done in the last six months? Check all that apply
- Watched geocaching videos (e.g. YouTube, TikTok)
- Browsed geocaching-specific online groups (e.g. Reddit, Facebook Groups, Geocaching Forums)
- Posted a question on a geocaching online group (e.g. Reddit, Facebook Groups, Geocaching Forums)
- Listened to a geocaching podcast
- Read web articles about geocaching
- Sent a message to someone on the Geocaching App
- Went to a geocaching-specific event
- Found a geocache with a more experienced geocacher
- Used the Geocaching mobile app
- Used Geocaching.com website
- Found a geocache that someone else recommended to me
- Talked about geocaching with someone else over the phone or in person
- None of the above

4. Think of a recent memorable geocaching experience. Walk me through that day, morning to night, in detail. Why did you go geocaching that day? Where did you go? What did you do after?

5. Describe a moment of joy from a recent geocaching experience in detail. What happened? How did you feel? How does that express what you like about geocaching?

6. Describe a moment of frustration from a recent geocaching experience. What happened? What can we do to improve it?
You are an experienced User research expert. You are assigned a task to recruit users to research a product.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA = We're recruiting casual gamers 18-35 located in United States who actively play MeChat, LoveLink or BitLife searching for a more engaging & fun story-game experience to help us test a new mobile dating sim.

1. How old are you?
- Under 18
- 18-24
- 25-35
- 36-50
- 51-64
- 65+

2. How often do you play games online with others?
- multiple times a day
- daily
- few times a week
- weekly
- monthly
- occasionally
- never

3. In the last 6 months, which games or apps did you engage with?
- Dating apps (Tinder, Bumble, Hinge, Smitten, Snack, Grindr, etc)
- Personality Quizzes (Buzzfeed, Quiplash, OKCupid, etc)
- Story Games (Episode, Chapters, Choices, Tabou, etc)
- Quick-play story games (Reigns, Bitlife, etc)
- Dating sims (Mechat, Winked, Lovelink, etc)
- Virtual social worlds (HiRise, Avakin Life, IMVU, etc)
- Life Sims (Superstar Life, Hollywood Story, The Sims, Party in my Dorm)
- Multi-player casual games (Words w/Friends, QuizUp, Draw Together, Among Us, etc)

4. Describe a recent session playing a game you enjoy - start to finish. Which game did you play? What made it fun? Did you play solo - or with others? Did you discuss it with anyone afterwards?

5. Describe a 'feeling of connection' you experienced recently while gaming with someone else. What happened? Who were you playing with? Why was it meaningful?

6. What could be better about your experience playing games with others? What's one thing you wish you could do with someone else in (or around) a game, to make it more fun & satisfying for you?

CRITERIA = We're recruiting parents 25-55 located in United States who have school-aged kids searching for a better, more convenient way to learn & enjoy math to help us test a new math game for kids.

1. What grade level or age is your child? If you have more than one child, check all that apply.
- Grade 1 (ages 6-7)
- Grade 2 (ages 7-8)
- Grade 3 (ages 8-9)
- Grade 4 (ages 9-10)
- Grade 5 (ages 10-11)
- Other…

2. What type of school does your child attend? Check all that apply.
- Public school
- Charter school
- Private school
- Home school
- Other…

3. In the last six months, what extra-curricular math enrichment activities has your child done?
- Private tutoring
- Kumon, C2, Sylvan, Mathnasium
- Russian School of Mathematics
- Khan Academy (web site)
- Coding camps or classes
- Mad Science camps or classes
- GATE program activities
- Revolution math
- Other…

4. What does your child most enjoy about math? Please be specific.

5. In what ways are you dissatisfied with your child's math education? What's been frustrating or limiting?

6. What outcomes do you want for your child's math education? What changes would you like to see to achieve those outcomes?
You are a User Research expert. You have been assigned to create a 6-question screener for user interviews. The aim is to select the best candidates for research.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA: We're recruiting grassroots fundraisers 25-55 located in United States who want to see the impact of their contributions searching for a tool to improve their fundraising experience to help us test an NFT-powered political fundraising app.

1. In the last 12 months, how frequently have you contributed to a political campaign?
- Weekly (or more often)
- Monthly
- Quarterly
- A few times a year
- Once a Year
- Rarely
- Never

2. In the last 12 months, have you attended any of these events (online or in–person)? Check all that apply
- Democratic convention
- Campaign fundraising event
- Campaign volunteer event
- Democratic club event
- Activist or other organizer meetings
- Other

3. In the last 12 months, where did you go to learn or talk about candidates and campaigns?
Check all that apply
- DailyKos
- Politico
- Facebook Feed
- Facebook Groups
- Twitter
- Messaging Apps (WhatsApp, iMessage, Signal, Telegram, etc)
- Other

4. Walk me through the last time you donated to a campaign. What motivated or triggered your donation? And did you let others know afterwards? Please be detailed & specific.

5. Tell me about a recent meaningful, satisfying, or joyful moment you experienced making a campaign contribution. What made it special for you?

6. What's been frustrating or “missing” about your campaign donation experience? If you could wave a magic wand, what would you change?

Please write in English language.

CRITERIA: We're recruiting web coders 25-45 located in First The Philippines, then United States who want to get into Web3 coding searching for a more rewarding learning platform to help us test a Web3 learn-to-code game.

1. Which of these programming languages are you proficient at?
- Javascript
- PHP
- C sharp
- C++
- Python
- React
- Node.js (server)
- Java
- Other
- None

2. In the last 12 months, which of the following activities have you engaged in?
- Learned blockchain coding via free resources (blogs, Twitter, Reddit, YouTube, Dev Documentation)
- Learned blockchain coding via paid coursework and media
- Bought course on Udemy or Coursera on Blockchain programming
- Searched for blockchain coding education resources on Google or Youtube
- Joined a Discord community that helps people learn Blockchain coding
- Created a Hello World Solidity Project
- Freelance/employee Web2 engineer or IT professional
- Searched for Solidity/Rust Tutorials on Youtube
- Browsed Solidity/Rust Docs
- Tried Cryptozombies
- Browsed Crypto coding curriculum
- Completed Crypto coding learning module
- Talked to a friend about Ethereum/Solana/Polygon/Avalanche/Algo smart contracts
- Coded a simple DApp or Smart contract
- None
- Other

3. Which of these education solutions have you tried for learning Web3 coding?
- CryptoZombies
- Ethereum/Solidity Subreddit
- Youtube Tutorial
- Udemy Course
- Buildspace.so
- CryptoDevs
- Pair Programming in Discord Servers
- DevDao
- Other
- None

4. What type of games do you play regularly?
- Mobile
- Console
- PC
- Crypto Games
- Other
- None

5. Walk me through a recent experience trying to learn Web3 coding. What were you doing? What prompted you to do it? How did it go?

6. What specific app/community/course/experience has been the most helpful for you to learn Web3 coding and why? What about it was helpful?

Please write in English language.

Based on the CRITERIA provided, you will create a 6-question screener to select the best users to interview. CRITERIA: We're recruiting active outdoor enthusiasts 25-45 (role & age) located in United States who want to make their hobby more affordable (qualifying problem) searching for a VIP rewards program to drive engagement (solution-seeking) to help us test a new rewards program for outdoor enthusiasts (R&D).

1. Which outdoor sports have you participated in within the past 12 months?
- Running
- Hiking
- Backpacking
- Camping
- SCUBA Diving
- Rock Climbing
- Surfing
- Waterskiing/Wakeboarding
- Skiing / Snowboarding
- Hunting
- Fishing
- Cycling
- Golf
- Boating
- Other

2. In the past 12 months how often did your outdoor adventures involve travel?
- Few times a week
- Weekly
- Few times a month
- Monthly
- Seasonally
- Annually
- Never
- Other

3. How do you fund your outdoor adventures?
- I use my regular income
- Cash-in loyalty points to cover expenses (i.e., for travel, lodging, etc.)
- Part-time side gig helps me fund my hobby
- Parents, spouse or relatives help me cover costs
- I reduce costs by going with a group
- My friends chip in for me
- Sometimes I'll chip in more to include friends
- I organize/lead groups to help me offset the costs
- I'm sponsored by brands
- I put it on a credit card to pay over time
- Other

4. Tell us about your most exciting outdoor adventure from the past 12 months. Walk us through your preparation, expectations and your experience. (Be as detailed as possible)

5. Before, during, and after your most exciting outdoor adventure what tools, apps, websites and equipment did you find most useful or important? What worked well for you? (Be as detailed as possible)

6. What could have been better about the tools, apps, websites, and equipment you used? What do you wish you had that could have made your outdoor adventure better? (Be as detailed as possible)

Please write in English language.

CRITERIA: We're recruiting adults 25-55 located in United States who have been diagnosed with pre-diabetes searching for a more convenient way to manage their blood sugar level to help us test a new app to manage your blood sugar & get healthier.

1. Have you received any medical diagnosis related to management of blood glucose levels?
- Type 2 Diabetes
- Type 1 Diabetes
- Pre-diabetes
- Metabolic Syndrome
- Other
- None - I have no diagnosis around managing glucose levels

2. Which tools/apps/devices have you used to monitor your blood sugar levels?
- Eversense
- Glimp
